<u>Explanation of the figures <\u>
Fig. 1. <u>Appendicularia flagellum <\u> much magnified 
“” 2. still more magnified.
“” 2a. Extremity of the caudal appendage 
“”3. Body of Appendicularia from behind 
“”4. Individual in which the testis is much enlarged 
Fig.5. <u>Doliolum denticulatum <\u> from the right side 
“”6. Do. Do. from below.
“”7. A portion of the right wall to show the testis in situ 
“”8. The “ciliated sac” & the origin of the “ciliated bands “
in Doliolum
“”9. The intestine and heart with the commencement of the branchiae 
The letters have throughout the same signification 
a. ganglion with the auditory vesicle 
b. nerve - 
c. Endostyle 
d. Respiratory or anterior aperture 
e.f. ciliated bands 
g. Mouth 
h. Oesophagus 
i. stomach 
k. intestine 
l. Anus 
m. Axis of the caudal appendage 
n. Alary membrane 
o. bundles of striated muscular fibrils 
p. Testis 
p’ efferent duct of testis 
q. supposed ovary 
r. Heart 
s. Liver 
t. Muscular bands 
u. ciliated sac 
w. vascular sinus 
B. the Body of Appendicularia 
A. the caudal appendage 
x. hypopharyngeal band 
y. branchial bars 
z. the system of tubules embracing the intestine
